It could be said that travel was usually on foot because most of the popula=
tion could not afford horses. As far as I know those who did own their own =
horses were allowed to use them for personal travel as they wished. As far =
as the type of horse, I do not know what they are called in technical terms=
, but the horses of Sengoku period Japan were much smaller than the horses =
now. They were closer to ponies in size, they may actually be categorized a=
s ponies I am not sure, that were originally from the plains of central Asi=
a. When you consider that the average height of a Japanese man at the time =
was shorter than the average height of a Japanese woman today then the thou=
ght of them on a modern sized race horse, like those used in yabusame today=
, is kind of an amusing thought.
